cgb_rescale_potential.py¶

Rescale an EAM potential to match a target lattice parameter at 0K.

usage: cgb_rescale_potential [-h] (--fcc FCC | --bcc BCC)
                             [--precision PRECISION] [--strain STRAIN]
                             [--nsamples NSAMPLES]
                             [--init_dr_step INIT_DR_STEP]
                             [--lammps_force_convergence LAMMPS_FORCE_CONVERGENCE]
                             [--lammps_max_steps LAMMPS_MAX_STEPS]
                             [--procs PROCS] [--check_only]
                             potential species

Positional Arguments¶

potential Path to the empirical potential to rescale.
species Elemental symbol for the host (as referenced in the potential.)

Named Arguments¶

–fcc, -fcc Use fcc lattice and target given size (in angstroms).
–bcc, -bcc Use bcc lattice and target given size (in angstroms).
–precision, -prec
 

Precision for matching actual lattice constant to target.

Default: 1e-05

–strain, -stn

Maximum strain away from target value for energy-volume curve.

Default: 1e-05

–nsamples, -n

Number of points in energy-volume curve.

Default: 8

–init_dr_step, -dr0
 

Initial step for changing the potential’s dr value.

Default: 1e-05

–lammps_force_convergence, -ftol
 

Force convergence for all LAMMPS minimizations in eV/angstrom.

Default: 0.001

–lammps_max_steps, -lms
 

Max steps for LAMMPS energy minimization.

Default: 10000

–procs, -np

Max processors available to run mpi on.

Default: 1

–check_only, -check
 

Instead of rescaling the potential, just get its optimal lattice constant from an energy-volume curve.

Default: False
